properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 2 at 10:37PM MST until March 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOWS FOR MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS
ABOVE 7,000 FEET TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...

An upper level low tracking across the region will bring a
prolonged period of lowland rains and mountain snows to the
Borderland beginning Tuesday morning and ending Wednesday
evening. The heaviest snowfall is expected over the Sacramento
Mountains as snow showers become heavy through the night Tuesday
into Wednesday. New snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches will be
possible for locations above 8000 feet. 2 to 6 inches of snow
will be possible along the east slopes of the Sacramento
Mountains. Further west, snowfall over the Black Range will
produce 6 to 8 inches of new snow. Snowfall will end Wednesday
morning over the Black Range, then Wednesday evening over the
Sacramento Mountains.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches
over the Black Range, with 1 to 3 inches possible below 7500
feet.

* WHERE...Portions of southwest New Mexico within Grant and
Sierra Counties.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to midnight MST Tuesday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT
